'Am I Next?': In Los Angeles, a city targeted by ICE raids, an exhibition invites self-reflection
Subhead: In response to raids by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents, the facades of several buildings across the California metropolis display the message 'Am I Next?' along with the photo of an ordinary citizen. This open-air campaign serves as both an act of resistance and a manifesto intended to alert the broader public.

Title: In 'Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery,' Daniel Craig grapples with metaphysics
Subhead: The third installment of detective Benoît Blanc's investigations forces its protagonist to confront the murder of a priest, shaking his belief in rationalism.

Title: Five creative craft workshops to enjoy doing in Paris with your child
Subhead: Birdhouses, cuddly toys or hair clips. Almost anything can be crafted together as a family. All you have to do is sign up for one of the fun workshops offered in the capital by passionate professionals, and you'll have an original Christmas gift idea.

Title: Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
Subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
Subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

Title: 'Trump's ideological challenge to Europe is more dangerous than the security one'
Subhead: The Trump administration has cast itself as the protector of 'Western civilization.' Elon Musk wants the European Union to be dismantled. It is up to European democrats to contest this role and fight this battle, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

Title: How the Israeli army is razing the part of Gaza it is supposed to withdraw from
Subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.
